citation.title: Clues to the Opioid Crisis in Monitoring the Future but Still Looking for Solutions

news.title: Studies shed light on opioid exposures among US children and young adults
news.summary: (Reuters Health) - Between 2000 and 2015, poison control centers in the United States received 188,468 calls about prescription opioid exposures in children and teens, a new study finds.

news.title: Studies shed light on opioid exposures among US children and young adults
news.summary: Between 2000 and 2015, poison control centers in the United States received 188,468 calls about prescription opioid exposures in children and teens, a new study finds.

news.title: Fewer U.S. Kids Overdosing on Opioids: MedlinePlus Health News

news.title: These Are The 2 Key Ways People Get Hooked On Prescription Opioids

news.title: Recent Decline in Prescription Opioid Use Among U.S. Teens
news.summary: (HealthDay News) -- For adolescents, medical and nonmedical use of prescription opioids has declined in recent years, according to a study published online March 20 in Pediatrics.
